transportAdvice: Cape Town has a commuter rail network and a bus rapid transit system that connects key tourist areas including the waterfront, city bowl, and some suburbs, though services can be infrequent and coverage is uneven. Taxis are widely available and recommended for flexibility, while walking is practical within the city centre and waterfront areas but less advisable in unfamiliar neighbourhoods after dark.

weather.description: Hot, dry, and sunny summer days with occasional strong southeasterly winds — peak beach and outdoor season.
The warmest month of the year with long sunny days and very little rainfall, ideal for outdoor activities.
Late summer remains warm and dry with slightly easing winds and comfortable evenings.
Autumn brings milder temperatures and the first hints of rain as the dry season transitions.
Noticeably cooler and wetter with overcast days becoming more frequent as winter approaches.
Winter sets in with regular rainfall, cool temperatures, and occasional stormy days — the wettest period.
The coldest and one of the rainiest months, with short days and frequent frontal systems bringing wind and rain.
Still firmly in winter with continued rainfall and cool conditions, though days gradually lengthen.
Spring arrives with warming temperatures and decreasing rain, though weather can still be changeable.
Pleasant spring weather with wildflowers in bloom and increasingly sunny days between passing showers.
Warm and mostly dry with long daylight hours — an excellent time to visit before peak summer crowds.
Hot summer conditions return with minimal rain, busy beaches, and a festive atmosphere across the city.
